actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to limit the amount of contributions to political committees advocating the election of unannounced candidates for Federal office.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit: (1) any person from contributing over $1,000 to a political committee advocating the election to a Federal office of an individual who is not a candidate for such office; or (2) any multicandidate political committee from contributing over $5,000 to such a committee.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to limit the amount of contributions to political committees advocating the election of unannounced candidates for Federal office.
